verb.description: Give (someone) something, typically money, in recognition of loss, suffering, or injury incurred; recompense.
examples: payments were made to farmers to compensate them for cuts in subsidies

verb.description: Reduce or counteract (something unwelcome or unpleasant) by exerting an opposite force or effect.
examples: the manager is hoping for victory to compensate for the team's dismal league campaign

origin: Mid 17th century (in the sense counterbalance): from Latin compensat- weighed against, from the verb compensare, from com- together + pensare (frequentative of pendere weigh).
